Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Mayer I. Perelmuter, Reform Temple of Forest Hills, 71-11 112th Street, Flushing, N.Y.  11375-4649.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Koslowitz.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Mayer I. Perelmuter, Reform Temple of Forest Hills, 71-11 112th Street, Flushing, N.Y. 11375-4649.



Council Member Koslowitz moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 23, 2011 be adopted as printed by Council Member Williams.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Williams moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 23, 2011 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Nancy G. Chaffetz to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her reappointment to the New York City Civil Service Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 813 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Nancy G. Chaffetz, New York City Civil Service Commission

Items.Title: Submitting the name of Rudy Washington to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his reappointment to the New York City Civil Service Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 813 of the City Charter.

Items.MatterName: Rudy Washington, NYC Civil Service Commission

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-2269(g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 763 9th Ave., Community Board 4, Application 20115007 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 763 Ninth Ave, Manhattan (20115007 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Consumer Affairs
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring pedicabs to be subject to parking rules.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring pedicabs to be subject to parking rules.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to seizing pedicabs and suspending and/or revoking pedicab registration plates and drivers’ licenses for certain violations.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Seizing pedicabs and suspending and/or revoking pedicab registration plates and drivers’ licenses for certain violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the permitted number of pedicab registration plates.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Permitted number of pedicab registration plates.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving the granting of an exemption for real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the Real Property Tax Law, for the 2008, 2009, and 2010 assessment rolls for the parcel owned by the Foundation for Sephardic Studies, Inc. in the City of New York, borough of Brooklyn, designated on the tax map as block 07089, lot 07  in such borough, and the cancellation of  taxes, fines, penalties and interest remaining unpaid, and the making of appropriate correction of the subject assessment rolls, if, upon  accepting and reviewing the application or renewal application for such exemption, the Department of Finance is satisfied that such corporation would otherwise be entitled to such exemption if it had filed such application for exemption by the appropriate taxable status date, in accordance with, and upon the effective date of, the chapter law represented by Assembly Bill A. 4773-A.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Approving the granting of an exemption for real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the real property tax law. (A.4773-A)

Items.Title: Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for property located at 155-161 East 103rd Street (Block 1631, Lot 25) Manhattan, pursuant to Section 577 of the Real Property Tax Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 371).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 371 - 155-161 East 103rd Street, Manhattan

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President Obama to sign the Optional Protocol to the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women and the Senate to ratify both the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women and the Optional Protocol to the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Optional Protocol to the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the 112th United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign,  the Tibetan Refugee Assistance Act of 2011 (H.R. 6690), which would allow certain Tibetans admission to the United States.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass, and the President to sign,  the Tibetan Refugee Assistance Act of 2011 (H.R. 6690)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York, the New York City Department of Transportation and the New York City Planning Commission to increase the number of commercial loading zones within the central business district of Manhattan and to lawfully require off street loading docks to be built when any new commercial buildings are constructed or substantially renovated within the central business district of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Increase the number of commercial loading zones within the central business district of Manhattan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing disabled veterans to use express lanes or high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lanes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing disabled veterans to use express lanes or high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lanes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the use of adhesive stickers on motor vehicles in the enforcement of alternate side of the street parking rules.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Limiting the use of adhesive stickers on motor vehicles in the enforcement of alternate side of the street parking rules.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of citywide administrative services in its annual report regarding eligible lists to include information regarding veterans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Requiring DCAS in its annual report regarding eligible lists to include information regarding veterans.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the department of citywide administrative services including on applications for open examinations a question as to whether an applicant is a veteran.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: DCAS including on applications for open examinations a question as to whether an applicant is a veteran.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of citywide administrative services to post the estimated number of open competitive civil positions at the same time as the posting of the examination notice.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring DCAS to post the estimated number of open competitive civil positions at the same time as the posting of the examination notice.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing a fine for lesser violations of the building code for certain structures.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Imposing a fine for lesser violations of the building code for certain structures.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clarifying bicycle access in office buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Clarifying bicycle access in office buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the number of water fountains at or near public parks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Increasing the number of water fountains at or near public parks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of temporary parking spaces for persons who are changing residences.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Issuance of temporary parking spaces for persons who are changing residences.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass a bill that would create a public campaign financing system with matching funds for small contributions for candidates running for New York State public office.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Create a public campaign financing system with matching funds for small contributions for candidates running for NYS public office.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the minimum thresholds for eligibility for public funding for candidates for city council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Increasing the minimum thresholds for eligibility for public funding for candidates for city council.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the granting of an exemption for real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the Real Property Tax Law, for the 2008, 2009, and 2010 assessment rolls for the parcel owned by the Foundation for Sephardic Studies, Inc. in the City of New York, borough of Brooklyn, designated on the tax map as block 07089, lot 07  in such borough, and the cancellation of  taxes, fines, penalties and interest remaining unpaid, and the making of appropriate correction of the subject assessment rolls, if, upon  accepting and reviewing the application or renewal application for such exemption, the Department of Finance is satisfied that such corporation would otherwise be entitled to such exemption if it had filed such application for exemption by the appropriate taxable status date, in accordance with, and upon the effective date of, the chapter law represented by Assembly Bill A. 4773-A.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the granting of an exemption for real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the real property tax law. (A.4773-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, the New York Dream Act, which would grant certain benefits to eligible undocumented immigrants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: New York Dream Act

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting restraining animals outdoors for longer than three continuous hours.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting restraining animals outdoors for longer than three continuous hours.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the publication of quarterly reports by the New York City Police Department on quality of life summonses issued and graffiti-related arrests made.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Submission of quarterly reports by the NYPD on quality of life summonses issued and graffiti-related arrests made.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to immediately stop serving food and beverages that contain high fructose corn syrup.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to immediately stop serving food and beverages that contain high fructose corn syrup.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a one-year moratorium on penalties for residential buildings owned as a cooperative that fail to file benchmark energy and water efficiency reports.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Creating a one-year moratorium on penalties for residential buildings owned as a cooperative that fail to file benchmark energy and water efficiency reports.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exemption of a residential building owned as a cooperative from the obligation to benchmark energy and water efficiency.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Exemption of a residential building owned as a cooperative from the obligation to benchmark energy and water efficiency.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of parking regulations during and after snowfalls.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Suspension of parking regulations during and after snowfalls.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Savino, S.1610, and Assembly Member Brook-Krasny, et al., A.6599, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland of parcels of  real  property  in  the  borough  of  Brooklyn  in exchange  for the dedication of certain other lands in the borough of Brooklyn for park purposes in furtherance of a comprehensive development plan for Coney Island.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Discontinue the use as parkland of parcels of  real  property  in  the  borough  of  Brooklyn  in exchange  for the dedication of certain other lands in the borough of Brooklyn for park purposes in furtherance of a comprehensive development plan for Coney

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, May 11, 2011.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, 
City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
